hc.server.ui

Class MenuItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • hc.server.ui.MenuItem

  • public class MenuItem
extends Object
    An implementation of an item in a menu. A menu item is essentially a button sitting in a list.

    A menu presented on the mobile client is composed of menu items of project level and session level, items of session level are visible only to owned session and will automatically gone after logout or line-off.

    The menu items in [Items Tree] in designer are project level, invoking ProjectContext.getMenuItemBy(String, String) to get it.
    Since:
    7.20
    See Also:
    ProjectContext.addMenuItem(MenuItem), ProjectContext.insertMenuItemToProjectLevel(MenuItem, int), ProjectContext.insertMenuItemToSessionLevel(MenuItem, int), ProjectContext.getMenuItemFromProjectLevel(int), ProjectContext.getMenuItemFromSessionLevel(int), ProjectContext.getMenuItemsSizeOfProjectLevel(), ProjectContext.getMenuItemsSizeOfSessionLevel(), ProjectContext.removeMenuItemFromProjectLevel(int), ProjectContext.removeMenuItemFromSessionLevel(int)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuItem

        public MenuItem(String text,
                String scheme,
                String elementID,
                BufferedImage icon,
                String scripts)
        creates a MenuItem with the specified parameters.

        to set internationalization texts, see setText(String[], String[])
        Parameters:
        text - the text of the item.
        scheme - one of CMD_SCHEME, FORM_SCHEME.
        elementID - for example, a menu item for Mlet is "form://MyForm", then the elementID is "MyForm".
        icon - the best image size is 128 X 128 for current version.
        scripts - the response scripts for the menu item.
        Since:
        7.20

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        true means the MenuItem is enable; false means disable.
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.20

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean b)
        if the MenuItem is set to disable, then the icon will be gray on mobile immediately.

        if the MenuItem is added in project level, then the change will apply to all mobile clients.

        actions on a disabled MenuItem will be invalid.
        Parameters:
        b -
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.insertMenuItemToProjectLevel(MenuItem, int)

      • setIcon

        public void setIcon(BufferedImage icon)
        set icon of MenuItem.

        if the MenuItem is displayed on mobile, then it will be refreshed immediately.

        if the MenuItem is added in project level, then the change will apply to all mobile clients.

        if the MenuItem is set to disable, then the icon will be gray on mobile immediately.
        Parameters:
        icon - the best image size is 128 X 128 for current version.
        Since:
        7.20

      • setScripts

        public void setScripts(String scripts)
        change the scripts for current menu item.

        Important :
        the scripts of menu item works in session level, no matter which is added to set of project level or session level.
        Parameters:
        scripts -
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.insertMenuItemToProjectLevel(MenuItem, int), ProjectContext.insertMenuItemToSessionLevel(MenuItem, int)

      • setText

        public boolean setText(Map map)
        if the MenuItem is displayed on mobile, then it will be refreshed.

        if the MenuItem is added in project level, then the change will apply to all mobile clients.

        for example, map is {"en-US" -> "Hello", "fr-FR" -> "Bonjour"}.
        Parameters:
        map - the map text for key locales.
        Returns:
        false means map is null
        Since:
        7.46
        See Also:
        setText(String[], String[])

      • setText

        public void setText(String text)
        if the MenuItem is displayed on mobile, then it will be refreshed.

        if the MenuItem is added in project level, then the change will apply to all mobile clients.

        Important :
        if there is no match in map, which is put by setText(String[], String[]), setText(Map) or designer, then the text is used for menu item.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        setText(String[], String[])

      • setText

        public boolean setText(String[] locales,
                       String[] texts)
        if the MenuItem is displayed on mobile, then it will be refreshed.

        if the MenuItem is added in project level, then the change will apply to all mobile clients.

        for example, locales is {"en-US", "fr-FR"}, texts is {"Hello", "Bonjour"}.
        Parameters:
        locales - the array for locale
        texts - the array for text
        Returns:
        false means locales is null, texts is null or array lengths are not equal.
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        setText(Map), setText(String)
